featured.text: Many of his works—depictions of children at play and in school, farm girls attending to their work, hunters and their prey—have become classic images of nineteenth-century American life.
What is the main idea of the passage? (A) William Hunter was a very brave boy. (B) Hunter saved Carnegie from drowning.
Which of the following statements is NOT true? (A) Carnegie knew Hunter in person.
In 1886, Carnegie heard about a young man by the name of William Hunter who lost his life trying to save two other boys from drowning.

definition.en_def: A person who hunts wild animals for food or sport.
definition.example: The hunter tracked the deer through the dense forest.
